page.content: Crail Sailing Club Open Day. It was a breezy morning when we went down to the harbour to put up the bunting and get the boats and canoes ready. Fortunately by afternoon the wind had dropped and the sun came out. Several hundred people came down and some tried their hands at paddling the canoes, or went for trips in the rescue boat, the 3 dinghies or the 2 yachts.Later a speedboat was also available. Everyone had to wear a lifejacket. The Coastguards had a stand,& the R.N.L.I. were selling crisps and lemonade and money-making lucky number Teddys. The helicopter from R.A.F. Leuchars came and gave a life-saving demonstration. The happy afternoon finished with a barbecue for all the hard-working members of the Crail Sailing Club.
